title: Views
description: Nuxt provides several component layers to implement the user interface of your application.

props.alt: The app.vue file is the entry point of your application

children.value: By default, Nuxt will treat this file as the
and render its content for every route of the application.

props.className: language-vue shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight

children.value: If you are familiar with Vue, you might wonder where
is (the file that normally creates a Vue app). Nuxt does this behind the scene.

props.alt: Components are reusable pieces of UI

children.value: Most components are reusable pieces of the user interface, like buttons and menus. In Nuxt, you can create these components in the
directory, and they will be automatically available across your application without having to explicitly import them.

props.className: language-vue shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight
language-vue shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight

props.alt: Pages are views tied to a specific route

children.value: Pages represent views for each specific route pattern. Every file in the
directory represents a different route displaying its content.
for default entry). You can now create more pages and their corresponding routes by adding new files in the

children.value: This page will be displayed at the /about route.
Layouts are wrappers around pages that contain a common User Interface for several pages, such as a header and footer display. Layouts are Vue files using
file will be used by default. Custom layouts can be set as part of your page metadata.
If you only have a single layout in your application, we recommend using

If you only need to modify the

You can have full control over the HTML template by adding a Nitro plugin that registers a hook.
The callback function of the
hook allows you to mutate the HTML before it is sent to the client.

that can be used to write to any Node.js stream.

html .light .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-light);background: var(--shiki-light-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-light-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-light-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-light-text-decoration);}html.light .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-light);background: var(--shiki-light-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-light-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-light-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-light-text-decoration);}html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}
